events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on a busy street, submitting initial claim details.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords and customer description of the car damage.
An agent specializing in auto insurance claims was assigned to the case to manage proceedings efficiently.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and next steps for their accident report.
Requested the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documentation including the official police report and mechanic's damage assessment.
Investigation was initiated to verify claim information, examine submitted evidence, and contact involved parties.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of the collision circumstances and validation of the damage reported.
A settlement amount covering repairs and associated costs was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the offer and communication.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was officially approved to proceed with the payment disbursement.
The settlement payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s account to cover vehicle repairs and losses.
The claim case was closed after full payment, with confirmation from the customer that the repairs were completed.
The claim file was archived in the system for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
